titleStmt.title: A particular and exact account of the trial of Mary Compton, the bloody and most cruel midwife of Poplar: as also of her maid, Mary Compton the younger; who were both araigned in one indictment for felony and murder, in destroying, starving to death, and famishing several poor infant babes: : as also Ann Davis as accessary.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Richard Baldwin, near the Oxford-Arms in Warwick Lane,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: Newberry Library, Chicago, Illinois.
